intro: Camissonia breviflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Camissonia breviflora is adapted to coastal and inland scrub environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
